chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

04:07 PM Defendant Matthew Allen Utzig in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David Zarwell and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court orders a $1000 Signature Bond with conditions:  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No intentional contact with Officer Limberg. Must remain in residence from 7pm to 7am unless at work or traveling to and from work. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2022.
Absolute sobriety. No intentional contact with Officer Limberg. Not to possess any controlled substance unless prescribed. Curfew from 7pm to 7am unless traveling to/from work.
